events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred at an intersection resulting in visible damage to the front bumper.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on the description involving the car collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and begin coordination with the claimant.
The claim acknowledgement letter was sent promptly to the claimant thanking them for their submission.
Additional documents such as police report, photos of damage, and repair estimate were requested to proceed.
The insured submitted all requested documents including detailed photos and official police collision report.
The internal investigation began to validate the circumstances of the accident and verify claim legitimacy.
Investigation confirmed the car collision details and determined that the claimant was not at fault.
A settlement covering all damages including repairs and rental vehicle expenses was proposed to the insured.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the quick processing and transparent communication of the claim.
The claim was formally approved by underwriting following the successful completion of all verifications.
The payout to cover the vehicle repair costs was issued to the insured’s account without delay.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed to the customer’s satisfaction.
